row.Body: "Space Exploration" is the default name for our chat room, but that's a little on the bland side. What would be a fitting name for the default SpaceEx room?
row.Title: What should our chat room's name be?

row.Body: Should we disallow the exploration tag? I don't think it's going to be very useful, since theoretically this entire Stack Exchange site is about Space Exploration.
row.Title: Should we disallow the Exploration tag?

row.Body:
Yes.

space and exploration are now considered "intrinsic" tags (applicable to all questions) and cannot be used.

I've started on the tagging, and I've already noticed two related tags: space-law and international-law. The few questions I've noticed could be tagged with either, as far as I can tell.

  1. Are we going to pick one? If so:
  2. Which one will it be?
  3. Or would law make more sense?
row.Title: Tags: space-law vs. international-law

row.Body: Ten Forward! Stealing for Star Trek of course.

How important does everyone feel that equations are here? Other communities like physics and math uses MathJax, which will render equations typed in LaTeX. That has to be added to the site code, and I admit I do not know how this is done.

As a PSA, I use the quicklatex site when the MathJax isn't available. You can paste LaTeX there and then it will produce an image with a URL, you can use the URL directly to put the equation in your answer. It's certainly better than writing it out in plain text.
row.Title: Writing equations (Mathjax and alternatives)

row.Body:
I'm thinking international-law should be for questions relating to laws that are not specifically for space, whereas space-law should be used for questions relating to laws that were specifically drafted for space.

Example:

  • Anti-Ballistic Missile Treaty would be international-law because it is also for fully ground based weaponry, not just space based weaponry.
  • Outer Space Treaty would be space-law because it was specifically written and only applies to actions in space.

I think it would be a good feature, but I'm not sure how many questions we will have here that would make use of the ability to write equations. If we were to have a number of those types of questions, I feel it would be very useful.

The Pod Bay

Dave went there to chat to Frank...seems appropriate
